job_title: Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: Good Holiday Bonus and parties
cons: Heavy caseload no proper training

pros: Great staff super nice people
cons: Not really any cons maybe location

pros: great place to work and grow.
cons: needs more grants and programs.

review_title: ok place to earn hours as an LMSW
pros: plenty of hours toward clinical license, friendly mental health department, some flexibility & understanding of life circumstances
cons: salary less than great, inconsistent supervision, no growth

pros: none that i can remember. it was not pleasant to work there.
cons: too many to mention. i had a negative experience for many years.

review_title: Terrible experience at the education and prevention department
job_title: Care Navigator in New York, NY
pros: Learned how to cope in hostile work environments and became an expert in dealing with unprofessionalism among other unpleasant things
cons: Mental health suffered, supervisors are vastly incompetent with some not even speaking or writing proper English yet wanting to correct and dissect every move their employees made

job_title: Senior Health Educator in New York, NY
pros: I had the opportunity to work with different communities, for sample LGBT community, HIV positive community, Heterosexual community, IDU community.
cons: Lack of opportunity for growth.

pros:
Great team to work with
Helped Chronically ill individuals
My office was a block away from my house😊
cons:
Office space was tight.
Work being done for an inhouse pharmacy
As you see, I have no "cons" I loved what I did and the agance I worked for.

pros: ACQC is client focused and supportive to their employees. They live their mission.  Family friendly environment with great work/life balance. Great place to work!
cons: Compensation can be on the low end; focus on training and development should be improved.

pros: Flexible hours, easy to get to using public transit.
cons: Benefits could be better. Senior Management needs to be more involved of day to day operations.

pros: Great work-life balance.  Great office culture.  Diverse staff.  Everyone is genuinely committed to helping those the agency serves.   Good benefits.
cons: Modest pay.  Crowded work space.

job_title: Peer Leader/Case Manager in Queens Village, NY
pros: great enviorment to learn and develop all skills in the field of public health and substance abuse
cons: distance of travel to places

job_title: Program Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Community of co-workers, feels like a second home if you know who to trust
cons: Management can be inadequate. Promotion should be based on skill and knowledge and not just length of time worked there

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Flexible schedule, friendly coworkers
cons: Work was inconsistent and useless

pros: it is a great school if you don't have any experience
cons: low pay, terrible organization, unprofessional boss and supervisors and very lazy staff
